headline: Why Analysts Call Lithium Americas' DOE Partnership A 'Game Changer
summary: Shares of Lithium Americas Corp (NYSE:LAC) soared in early trading on Wednesday after the company announced an agreement with the U.S. Department of Energy, in conjunction with General Motors Co (NYSE:GM). Here are some key analyst takeaways: Wedbush analyst Daniel Ives maintained a Neutral rating, while raising the price target from $5 to $8. JPMorgan analyst Bill Peterson does not have a rating on the stock. Wedbush: Lithium Americas has reached a non-binding agreement with the U.S. Department

headline: Momentum Behind EVs Over Hybrids
summary: Jon McNeill, CEO and Co-founder at DVx Ventures who is also a member at GM's Board of directors says that hybrids will fade over time as EV technology advances. He also says Chinese EVs are "heavily subsidized" and raise data-security questions, making US entry unlikely without tough trade negotiations. He spoke with Scarlet Fu on "Bloomberg Markets."

raw.headline: Momentum Behind EVs Over Hybrids

headline: Why General Motors (GM) Shares Are Trading Lower Today
summary: Shares of automotive manufacturer General Motors (NYSE:GM) fell 2.9% in the afternoon session after the company announced a recall for over 23,000 of its 2024 Chevrolet Equinox EV models and separately placed 900 workers on indefinite layoff.

raw.headline: Why General Motors (GM) Shares Are Trading Lower Today

headline: Tesla: What the end of the EV tax credit means for automakers
summary: Tesla (TSLA) reported record third quarter EV deliveries — 497,099 (vs. expectations of 439,612) — on Thursday as the electric vehicle tax credit expired on September 30. Additionally, US automakers Ford (F) and General Motors (GM) saw notable gains in their own vehicle sales, propped up by EVs. Kelley Blue Book executive editor Brian Moody speaks with Allie Canal about what these sales figures signal for the EV market and Tesla heading into the fourth quarter. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: General Motors, Ford Hit Record EV Deliveries In Q3: Tax Credit Expiration Or Lasting Growth?
summary: Ford Motor Co (NYSE:F) and General Motors Co (NYSE:GM) both reported record electric vehicle sales in the third quarter. While this could be good news for the growing adoption of EVs in the U.S., the big question is how much of the growth was tied to the expiration of the $7,500 federal tax credit. F stock is trading at elevated levels. Follow the breaking news here. headline: GM exec. discusses tariffs, strong Q3 sales, and EV tax credit
summary: General Motors (GM) reported strong third quarter sales. GM's Buick and GMC global vice president, Jaclyn McQuaid, sits down with Yahoo Finance Senior Reporters Allie Canal and Pras Subramanian to discuss tariff impacts, sales trends, the China market, the expiration of the electric vehicle (EV) tax credit, and more. Check out Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi's interview with Ford (F) CEO Jim Farley. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.
